text: Is there a parallel to "flex-grow" from CSS Flexbox in the UI-Extensions Flex component?
Yep, just found it. For anyone else looking into this, look at the Box ui-component! <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/box>

<https://arc.net/l/quote/mncpoqgp>

Do you think we'll see cache headers in the near future for `HubSpot.fetch()`?
Is there a way to make a form field that accepts images? I only see text field inputs
You could potentially use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/ui-components/crm-data-components/crm-property-list|CrmPropertyList> for that
No, I'm looking for a way to send, in the `fetch()` call, an actual file. Some way for customer to upload files to send to third-party servers.

I see. Unfortunately, file upload to third party is not directly possible today but it is something we are actively looking into.

<@U063P3TKE3V> could you tell me more about your use case? Do you want your file to be stored in HubSpot at all? Or directly to your third party server?

Either way, but going straight to third party would be better. Our use case is that I am working for an SMS Texting Solution (Business-to-Customer). We want to make a text conversation history tab that HubSpot users can text directly from. We want to support uploading attachments, which we support.

Can we create custom cards for the Lead object? documentation says we can for any standard object but Leads are not a standard object according to<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm| this documentation>
Yes you can use the same API for public apps as well.
